creator: dlai333@hotmail.com
text:
I'm using FOP 0.93 to convert FO to RTF. The FO has a numbered list with 3 
items numbered with letter a), b) and c). The numbered list in the output RTF 
is displayed correctly in MS Word as below:
a)	Item one
b)	Item two
c)	Item three

but if you add a new item by pressing 'Enter' and type 'Item four' at the end 
of the list you will get
a)	Item one
b)	Item two
c)	Item three
c)	Item four

It appears each list item is a list on its own and therefore the added list 
item is numbered as 'c)' not 'd)'. This problem also occurs for Roman (i. ii. 
etc) numbered list.

However for Arabic (1. 2. etc) numbered list, all list items are numbered 
as '1.' incorrectly in the output RTF.

1.0dev also gives the same results.

creator: adelmelle@apache.org
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 41389 ***

creator: dinistangerino@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 26221
patch that might fix this and another unreported bug

Hello all,

first of all, i believe this is not a duplicate of 41389.

i came across the same issue. all the numbered list items rendered with '1.'. Furthermore, a second problem was that all subsequent blocks after the list block, inside the same containing table cell block, would be prefixed with '2.', '3.' etc respectively.

i fixed the first problem by commenting a couple lines that, as david said, turned each list item in a list on its own. it seems to me like it is a relic from a time where something else wasn't working as it is now. someone else will have a a better judgement, but i didn't see any negative impact.

for the second problem, seems that the list block should be prefixed and suffixed with the 'pard' control word in order to restrain the formatting from "bleeding out" to neighbouring blocks. however, due to compatibility issues, this will explicitly not happen when the list is contained in a table. what i did was wrap the list with groupmarks regardlessly, ("{}") thus preventing the bleeding. again, this was just enough to solve my issue, and i didn't see any negative impact.

creator: gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
